In this latest issue the Cycling Plus team separate training facts from the widely believed fiction. Learn how to build a cycling club with guidance from those who have gone and done it, and reboot your riding and set yourself up for a strong summer with training tips from the experts.

Also in this issue, chief technical editor Warren Rossiter gets first rides of the Wilier Cento10 SL, Merida Silex+ 6000 gravel bike and the Canyon Precede:ON CF 9 ebike.

Plus! A 28-page guide to the thrilling Spring Classics.

Lockdown restrictions have made gravel riding even more appealing so the team at Cycling Plus has put to the test a quartet of versatile and durable bikes that dispense with carbon for steel and aluminium.

When Boris Johnson got into hot water when he was seen riding seven miles from Number 10, it got Cycling Plusâs feature editor John Whitney wondering about the delights in the immediate surrounds of his home in Bristol.

Build a club

The truth will out!

Cramping is due to dehydration; ride as low as possible; an ounce off the wheels is worth a pound off the frame: the cycling world is full of advice as to how to become a better cyclist so the Cycling Plus team investigate what is fact and what is fictionâ¦
